poem:
Title: "Evolve, the Story"

Retold in tales of yesteryears,
ichor flows in scribed lines,
Everett's Finn, Kingsolver's Copperhead,
fresh colors on the vine.

Newman's Julia, unstitched 1984 facade,
each woven frame a sister,
A cursive dance, a borrowing of thoughts,
encapsulating literary mister.

Stories morph, in hands they twirl,
as seasons gently wane,
Not death but life, in art we swirl,
a forever changing game.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. If each work of art builds on what came before it,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
